bibl.title: Letter from J.V. Sutton to Henry Rose Carter, November 15, 1922

div1.p: Sutton informs Carter that the Camden court cases will not be tried.

div1.head: Letter from J.V. Sutton to Henry Rose Carter, November 15, 1922
div1.opener:
WATEREE POWER COMPANY
CHARLOTTE, N.C.
ADDRESS ALL COMMUNICATIONS TO THE COMPANY,
AND IN REPLY TO THIS LETTER PLEASE REFER TO THESE INITIALS____
Nov. 15, 1922.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
301 Woodward Bldg.,
Birmingham, Ala.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
As I wired you today, the Camden court
adjourned Saturday on account of lack of funds on which to
run the court, therefore, our cases will not be tried. I
am very sorry as we were ready to try these cases.

I thank you very kindly for your willing-
ness to attend the trial of these cases.

I trust you are having a fine time on your
trip and that your health is back to its normal state and
that you are feeling your usual self.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, J. V. Sutton
Chief Claim Agent.
